description: Replacement of an existing illuminated 48-sheet advertisement display with an illuminated 48-sheet digital advertisement display
decision_conditions: Staff employed in the preparation, maintenance & completion of official poll cards

Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The intensity of the illumination of the lighting permitted by this consent shall be no greater than 500 cd/m in daylight and 300 cd/m at night and shall not contain any movement, animation or special effects whatsoever. Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
B1 - Means of Warning and Escape

The site is located in Kingston Town Centre. The site is not located in a conversation area.The application seeks to display 1no.x internally illuminated Fascia sign, 1no.x non illuminated Fascia sign and 1no. internally illuminated projecting sign.The key areas of assessment are:- The impact of the proposal on the character and appearance of the area;- The impact of the proposal on highway safety; and,Amenity The proposed installation of replacement internally lit double sided advertisement sign by virtue of its sitting in a prominent position in the public highway and tall appearance would lead to an incongruous addition to the streetscene. This would be visually intrusive creating visual street clutter, detracting from the character and appearance of the area. Public safetyThe proposed advertisement display would be static. It would not obstruct any highway signs and would not impede the free flow of vehicle or pedestrian movement. The advertisement would not result in a distraction to highway users and would not prejudice highway safety.In conclusion the proposal would not accord with section 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.
